intro: Epilobium hectorii, commonly known as Hector's willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pink to reddish-purple flowers. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant landscaping.
